verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.comment: Standard opening for divine speech. No significant difference.

verses.text: Take a census of the sons of Kohath among the sons of Levi, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.comment: Closer to 'take a count' or 'lift the head' idiomatically, but 'take a census' is accurate modern rendering.

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward, even to fifty years old, all who come to do the work in the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Ages 30–50 are repeated; reflects service years for Levites.

verses.text: This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting: the most holy things.
verses.comment: Clarifies Kohath's special duties: handling holy objects.

verses.text: When the camp is to set out, Aaron and his sons shall come and take down the veil of the screen and cover the ark of the testimony with it.
verses.comment: 'Veil of the screen' refers to the curtain before the Holy of Holies.

verses.text: Then they shall put on it a covering of goatskin and spread over that a cloth of pure blue, and shall put in its poles.
verses.comment: Describes procedure for transporting the Ark.

verses.text: Over the table of the bread of the Presence they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the plates, the dishes for incense, the bowls, and the flagons for the drink offering; the regular bread also shall be on it.
And they shall spread over them a cloth of scarlet and cover the same with a covering of goatskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.comment: Maintains Hebrew word order and instructions.

verses.text: They shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for the light, with its lamps, its tongs, its snuff dishes, and all the oil vessels used for it,
and they shall put it and all its utensils in a covering of goatskin and put it on the carrying frame.
verses.comment: The 'carrying frame' is literally 'the pole' or 'shoulder frame.'

verses.text: Over the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth and cover it with a covering of goatskin and shall put in its poles.
verses.comment: The golden altar refers to the altar of incense.

verses.text: And they shall take all the vessels of the service, which are used in the sanctuary, and put them in a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of goatskin and put them on the carrying frame.
verses.comment: Refers to utensils used in the sanctuary.

verses.text: They shall take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.

And they shall put on it all its utensils, with which they serve at the altar: the fire pans, the forks, the shovels, and the basins, all the utensils of the altar. They shall spread over it a covering of goatskin and put in its poles.
verses.comment: Lists altar utensils, as in Exodus.

verses.text: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, as the camp sets out, after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them. But they shall not touch the holy things, or they will die. These are the things in the tent of meeting that the sons of Kohath are to carry.
verses.comment: Warns Kohathites not to touch, only to carry after covering.

verses.text: Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering, and the anointing oil, with the oversight of all the tabernacle and all that is in it, in the sanctuary and its furnishings.
The LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.comment: Resumption of direct speech from God.

verses.text: Do not let the tribe of the clans of the Kohathites be cut off from among the Levites.
verses.comment: Command not to let them perish due to mishandling holy things.

verses.text: But do this to them, that they may live and not die when they come near to the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint each of them to his service and to his task,
but they shall not go in to look on the holy things even for a moment, or they will die.
The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Introduction to the Gershonite census instructions.

verses.text: Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers' houses and by their clans.
From thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, you shall list them, all who come to do duty, to serve in the tent of meeting.
This is the service of the clans of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:
verses.comment: Gershon assigned transport of certain tabernacle items.

verses.text: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tent of meeting, its covering and the covering of goatskin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the tent of meeting,

and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the door of the court that is around the tabernacle and the altar, and their cords and all the equipment and all their accessories. And they shall attend to all that needs to be done with these.
verses.comment: Gershonites responsible for fabrics and cords.

verses.text: All the service of the sons of the Gershonites shall be at the command of Aaron and his sons, in all that they are to carry and in all they have to do. And you shall assign to them all their duties and all their tasks.
This is the service of the clans of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting, and their duties shall be under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
As for the sons of Merari, you shall number them by their clans and their fathers' houses.
From thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, you shall list them, everyone who comes to do the service, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
And this is what they are responsible to carry, as their service in the tent of meeting: the frames of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, and its bases,
and the pillars around the court with their bases and pegs and cords, with all their equipment and all their accessories. And you shall list by name the objects that they are responsible to carry.
verses.comment: Every item assigned specifically by name.

verses.text: This is the service of the clans of the sons of Merari, the work in the tent of meeting under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
And Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of the congregation counted the sons of the Kohathites, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who could come to do the service in the tent of meeting.
And those listed by their clans were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
This was the list of the clans of the Kohathites, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the LORD by Moses.
verses.comment: Emphasizes the census was by divine command.

verses.text: And those listed of the sons of Gershon, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who could come to do the service in the tent of meeting,
those listed by their clans and their fathers' houses were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
verses.comment: The count matches the earlier total.

verses.text: This was the list of the clans of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the LORD.
verses.comment: The refrain is repeated for each group.

verses.text: Those listed of the clans of the sons of Merari, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who could come to do the service in the tent of meeting,
those listed by their clans were three thousand two hundred.
This was the list of the clans of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the LORD by Moses.
All those who were listed of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of Israel listed, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.comment: Summary begins for all Levite service census.

verses.text: from thirty years old and upward to fifty years old, everyone who could come to do the service of ministry and the service of bearing burdens in the tent of meeting,
those listed were eight thousand five hundred and eighty.
According to the commandment of the LORD through Moses they were listed, each one with his duty and his task of bearing burdens. Thus they were listed by him, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Final summarizing statement. Duties carefully distributed and counted.
